Description: Tondo sherd of Attic black-figured pottery Siana or little-master cup; interior, from outside: alternatind red and black tongues; band of staggered double dots between sets of triple black lines; in tondo, black-figure decoration consisting of hindquarters and tail of bull to right; exterior glazed.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 42, pl. XXI, no. 24)
Robertson 1951 / Gordion cups from Naukratis (p. 147, no. 12; p. 148, no. 12, fig. 2)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 385, no. B545)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1329) (phase 3)
